intro: Clytostoma callistegioides, commonly known as the purple-stemmed clytostoma, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
